meanings.definition: To engage in lively and noisy festivities or celebrations.
meanings.sent1: The children were roosing at the birthday party, laughing and playing games.
meanings.sent2: During the New Year's Eve party, everyone was roosing and having a great time.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors were roosing so loudly last night that I couldn't sleep!
meanings.sent4: The city streets were roosing with excitement during the annual parade.
meanings.sent5: The sound of music and laughter filled the air as the crowd began roosing.

meanings.definition: To engage in playful or rowdy behavior.
meanings.sent1: The puppies were roosing around in the backyard, chasing each other playfully.
meanings.sent2: The kids were roosing in the park, running and shouting with joy.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys at the zoo were roosing around, swinging from branch to branch.
meanings.sent4: The rowdy fans started roosing in the stands, cheering loudly for their team.
meanings.sent5: The group of friends began roosing around, causing a bit of chaos in the room.

meanings.definition: To engage in socializing or partying.
meanings.sent1: The guests were roosing at the wedding reception, chatting and dancing.
meanings.sent2: After a long week, it was nice to relax and roose with friends at the bar.
meanings.sent3: The office staff decided to roose together after work, sharing stories and jokes.
meanings.sent4: The students were roosing in the cafeteria, enjoying each other's company.
meanings.sent5: The community center was filled with people roosing and enjoying the evening together.
